title: Serum Ascites Albumin Gradient (SAAG)
desc: The Serum Ascites Albumin Gradient (SAAG) defines presence of portal hypertension (does not differentiate cause) in patients with ascites.

orgreference.text: Hoefs JC. The mechanism of ascitic fluid protein concentration increase during diuresis in patients with chronic liver disease. Am J Gastroenterol. 1981 Nov;76(5):423-31. PMID:7337129.

data.evidence: SAAG = (albumin concentration of serum) – (albumin concentration of ascitic fluid)
data.facts:
Interpretation

  • SAAG > 1.1 g/dL indicates portal hypertension is the cause of ascites with 97% accuracy.
  • SAAG scores do not indicate the cause of the portal hypertension.
